createDaoDetailsDialog.description: Start simple and learn as you go. You can adapt your DAO at any time.
createDaoDetailsDialog.title: Create new DAO

error.file-invalid-type: The selected file type is not supported. Upload a valid image file (e.g., PNG, JPG, GIF).
error.file-too-large: The file size exceeds the maximum allowed limit of 3 MB.
error.square-only: The image must be square. Upload a square image.
error.too-many-files: Only one file can be uploaded at a time
error.wrong-dimension: The image dimensions exceed the maximum allowed size of 1024x1024 pixels.

avatar.helpText: JPG, PNG, or GIF of no more than 3 MB and less than 1024x1024px.
avatar.label: Logo

description.helpText: Describe your DAO's purpose in a few sentences. This appears on the Explore page so new contributors can find you.
description.label: Description

name.helpText: Give your DAO a recognizable name.
name.label: DAO name

resources.helpText: Links to your DAO's website, social media profiles, Discord, or other places your community gathers.

network.helpText: The chain you choose is where your tokens and assets are stored.
network.label: Select blockchain

DEBUG.description: Debug step for creating your DAO
DEBUG.name: Debug
DEBUG.title: Debug

METADATA.description: Name and define your DAO so members know they've come to the right place. This information will be displayed at the top of your dashboard and can be changed with a vote.
METADATA.name: Describe your DAO
METADATA.title: Describe your DAO

NETWORK.description: The chain you choose is where your DAO and tokens will be deployed. If you already have a token, select the chain your token is on. This can't be changed later.
NETWORK.name: Select blockchain
NETWORK.title: Select blockchain

createProcessDetailsDialog.description: Governance should suit your organization's needs. Whether it's for funds management, protocol upgrades, or team coordination, you can add a new governance process at any time.
createProcessDetailsDialog.title: Create governance process

description.helpText: Summarize your {{type}} in 2-3 sentences. This helps DAO members understand the {{type}} in more detail.
description.label: Summary

name.helpText: Give your {{type}} an easily identifiable name.
name.label: Name

processKey.helpText: Define a key for this governance process to have a unique ID. Something like EIP, which leads to EIP-01 and increments for each proposal.
processKey.label: Key

resources.helpText: Add any additional external resources that help members understand the {{type}}.

proposalCreationBodies.error: You must select at least one body.
proposalCreationBodies.label: Bodies

proposalCreationMode.label: Who is eligible to create this type of proposal?

bodies.helpText: Add the governing bodies that decide whether or not this stage passes.

helpText.vetoing: The number of bodies that must veto this proposal to stop it from advancing.
helpText.voting: The number of bodies that must approve this proposal to advance it.

name.helpText: Give the stage a name that describes its role. For example: Community Review, Guardian Veto, or Founder Signoff.
name.label: Name

a11y.description: Configure the duration and expiration for the stage

earlyAdvance.helpText: Can this proposal be advanced early to subsequent stages if it's approved before the voting period ends?
earlyAdvance.label: Early stage advance

expiration.helpText: Should there be a limited time after the voting period ends for advancing the proposal to the next stage?
expiration.infoText: Recommended minimum expiration time is 7 days.
expiration.label: Stage expiration

timelockPeriod.helpText: The time that must pass before the proposal can advance.
timelockPeriod.label: Timelock period

votingPeriod.helpText: The amount of time bodies in this stage have to vote on proposals.
votingPeriod.infoText: Recommended minimum voting period is 7 days.
votingPeriod.label: Voting period

timing.helpText: Configure how long voting lasts and when the proposal can advance.
timing.label: Timing

type.helpText: Specify the role that governance plays. A normal stage passes only if it's approved. An optimistic stage passes unless vetoed. A timelock stage passes after its timelock period.
type.label: Type

NORMAL.description: Proposals pass this stage only if approved.
NORMAL.label: Normal

OPTIMISTIC.description: Proposals pass this stage unless vetoed.
OPTIMISTIC.label: Optimistic

TIMELOCK.description: Proposals pass this stage after the timelock period.
TIMELOCK.label: Timelock

METADATA.description: Information on this page is shown alongside proposals of this type. It helps voters understand the governance process and make informed decisions.
METADATA.name: Process description
METADATA.title: Describe new proposal type

PERMISSIONS.description: Define who can create proposals of this type.
PERMISSIONS.name: Proposal creation rules
PERMISSIONS.title: Set proposal creation rules

STAGES.description: Design how proposals of this type pass or fail. A proposal can go through multiple sequential stages. Each stage can approve or veto the proposal.
STAGES.name: Governance design
STAGES.title: Design the governance process

listener.info_2: on behalf of your DAO. Instead of going to your wallet, transactions will be made available to add as actions to the proposal.

adminVotingTerminal.title: Automatic execution

error.alreadyMember: Address is already a member of the DAO

endTime.helpText: Define when a proposal expires. After that time, you can't approve or execute it.
endTime.infoText: Itâs recommended to have an expiration time of {{days}} days to maintain a clean proposal list.
endTime.label: Expiration time

startTime.helpText: Define when a proposal is active to receive approvals. If now is selected, it starts immediately after publishing.
startTime.label: Start time

alert.majority: Proposal will be approved by majority
alert.minority: Proposals could be approved by a minority rather than a majority.

minimumApproval.helpText: Minimum approval is how many addresses must approve a proposal for it to pass.
minimumApproval.label: Minimum approval

advanceStageDialog.description: To advance the proposal to the next stage, confirm the onchain transaction in your wallet.
advanceStageDialog.title: Advance proposal

startTime.helpText: Define when the first stage starts. If now is selected, it starts immediately after publishing.
startTime.label: Start time

pending.description: Starts once the previous stage is advanced
pending.heading: Timelock pending

endTime.helpText: Set the duration of voting in days, or pick an exact date and time for it to end.
endTime.infoText: The minimum duration is {{days}} days, {{hours}} hours, and {{minutes}} minutes, set by DAO governance.
endTime.label: End time

startTime.helpText: Define when this proposal is active for voting. If now is selected, it starts immediately after publishing.
startTime.label: Start time

delegate.helpText: Enter the address where you want to delegate your current or future token balance's voting power.
delegate.label: Your delegation

dialog.description: To delegate to this address, confirm the onchain transaction in your wallet.
dialog.title: Delegate

tokenDelegationForm.info: Delegating increases the voting power of the address above by your balance. If you delegate to someone else, you can't vote until you reclaim your voting power.

selection.label: Who would you like to delegate to?

tokenGovernanceSettings.proposalAccess: Members with â¥ {{balance}} {{symbol}} voting power or balance

tokenProposalCreationRequirements.helpText: The voting power or token balance required to create proposals.
tokenProposalCreationRequirements.label: Minimum requirement

options.label: Do you want to {{label}} this proposal?

earlyExecution.helpText: Allows a proposal to be executed before the voting period ends. This is only possible if the proposal meets the support threshold, satisfies the minimum participation, and canât be overturned by remaining voters.
earlyExecution.label: Early execution

eligibleField.helpText: Specify who can create proposals and the minimum token requirement.
eligibleField.label: Who is eligible

members.description: Only members with at least this much voting power or token balance can create proposals.
members.label: Members

alert.description: Ensure members have enough time to vote. It's recommended to set this to at least 1 day.

minDuration.helpText: The shortest time a proposal is open for voting. Proposals can have a longer duration but not shorter.
minDuration.label: Minimum duration

minParticipation.helpText: This is the percentage of tokens that must participate, out of the total supply, for a proposal to pass.
minParticipation.label: Minimum participation

minVotingPower.helpText: Only members with at least this much voting power or token balance can create proposals.
minVotingPower.label: Minimum requirement

alert.majority: Proposal will be approved by majority
alert.minority: Proposals could be approved by a minority rather than a majority.

supportThreshold.helpText: The percentage of tokens voting Yes, out of the total votes cast, must exceed this for the proposal to pass.
supportThreshold.label: Support threshold

voteChange.helpText: Allows voters to change their vote during the voting period. This prevents the body from giving early approval or veto.
voteChange.label: Vote change

confirmWizardExit.message: If you leave this process, you'll lose all the information you've entered so far.

errorFeedback.description: If you'd like to help, you can report the issue to our team!
errorFeedback.title: Something went wrong

invalid.description: Some values are invalid. Review and fix them to proceed.
invalid.title: Invalid data

invalid-required.description: Some inputs are missing or invalid. Fix them to proceed.
invalid-required.title: Missing and invalid data

required.description: Some inputs are missing. Fill out all mandatory fields to proceed.
required.title: Missing data
